results.title: Evaluation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Depicts a school that takes its evaluation seriously. Keeping in touch with its community has required constant monitoring and some innovative adjustments. Staff, curriculum, in service and Supplementary Grants meetings are now one and the same and are occasions where parents and teachers learn together.

results.title: Hats in the Ring
results.brief_description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

results.title: Neat on Paper
results.creator_credit: Sydney Filmmakers' Co-op Action Group, Mandy King, James Kesteven and Miriana Marusic
results.brief_description: The Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-operative was a major national agency for the distribution and exhibition of independently produced Australian film and video for over 20 years. This program examines the issues surrounding its closure in 1986.

results.title: Walk softly: minimal impact bushwalking
results.brief_description: The rise in popularity of outdoor recreation has led to a vast increase in the number of bushwalkers visiting national parks and wilderness areas. With this rise in use has come increasing damage to the natural environment. Fortunately, a new bushwalking ethic has developed and the “Minimal Impact Bushwalking” philosophy is now widely adopted by bushwalkers. This program covers the major Minimal Impact Bushwalking techniques.

results.title: Snow safe
results.creator_credit: Australian Ski Patrol Association and Jack Creswick
results.brief_description: A well produced video looking at all aspects of ski and snow safety. Covers appropriate clothing and equipment, selection of equipment, getting proper ski instruction, ski slope courtesy and behaviour, using lifts, ski slope signs, what to do in case of accident or getting lost, care of children, food and hypothermia, and safe tobogganing. Narrated by Debbie Byrne.

results.title: Rolf Harris: How to Draw Fun Cartoons
results.brief_description: Yes, it’s the distinctive cartoons, drawings and humour of the unstoppable Rolf Harris and it’s Rolf Harris in person taking you through your very own “learn to draw” lesson. “You can draw”, says Rolf Harris. “We all can. It’s just a matter of knowing that you can draw your way”. How to draw fun cartoons, will give you as much pleasure watching as it will when you try out Rolf’s methods for yourself. Don’t say “I can’t draw” anymore, let Rolf Harris show you how.

results.title: Early Melbourne: from village to town
results.creator_credit: Lily Steiner, TV Ed Productions, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Dr Bernard Barrett, State Historian, discusses the early development of Melbourne, covering such topics as the naming of Melbourne, who decided where the streets would be located and what they would be called.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lily Steiner, TV Ed Productions, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Jeff Spencer

results.title: The Lost time capsule
results.creator_credit: Heather Ogilvie, Look At It My Way Films, Australian Bicentennial Authority and Geoffrey Bennett
results.brief_description: In the year 2088 a group of children discover a time capsule from the Bicentenary year. When opened it shows a short, musical, promotional film with the theme “Living together always”, highlighting the multicultural nature of Australian society, the outdoor life, brief film excerpts from Australia’s modern history, culminating in the creation of a mural by schoolchildren.

results.title: Even chance (A)
results.creator_credit: Sabina Baltrukomis, Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, Victoria. Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity and Martin Zierman
results.brief_description: Alice, a young Aboriginal woman, leaves her home in a country town to work in the city. She finds employment but things start to go wrong and eventually she is dismissed. Alice decides to take her case to the Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity. The program highlights examples of harassment, prejudice, stereotyping and discrimination.
